title: Oforia
description:
17 is the new 30. 40 is 25. Parenting is dead. And the big city was not intended to the life of adolescents. Euphoria draws a sexy, disturbing, and bold profile of the nineties generation, packed in turbulent drama peering into what is happening behind the closed doors of the children. In a visual cinematic language, which often reminds the "Elephant" or "Kids", spinning dialogues like "Trainspotting", "euphoria" brings the impossibility of age, through turbulent love stories, and drama. The main characters live in Internet fantasies, hallucinogenic drugs, the illusions of masturbation, schizophrenia and trauma, in narcissistic dreams - live everywhere but not in reality. Reality has been exhausted, and they are like an unripen fruit that has fallen. Lost and vulnerable, apathetic and hungry for excitement, they become a community Ã¢â‚¬â€œ in a city of loners. Together, chasing the euphoria and fluctuating between euphoria and paranoia.

An innocent boy escaped from a jeep chasing him wildly in front of a nightclub. It's a man-hunt. The boy is hit and falls to the ground. He manages pleading, "It wasn't me", before the driver, a teenager himself, lifts him off the ground and stabs him to death. The main characters were there that night, strangers.
